entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_NOTHING
entry.description: Does nothing.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_RETURN_TO_BASE
entry.description: Return vehicle to base.
entry.param: 0: return to base, 1: track mobile base

entry.name: MAV_CMD_STOP_RETURN_TO_BASE
entry.description: Stops the vehicle from returning to base and resumes flight.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_TURN_LIGHT
entry.description: Turns the vehicle's visible or infrared lights on or off.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GET_MID_LEVEL_COMMANDS
entry.description: Requests vehicle to send current mid-level commands to ground station.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_MIDLEVEL_STORAGE
entry.description: Requests storage of mid-level commands.
entry.param: Mid-level command storage: 0: read from flash/EEPROM, 1: write to flash/EEPROM

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_NONE
entry.description: No change to SLUGS mode.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_LIFTOFF
entry.description: Vehicle is in liftoff mode.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_PASSTHROUGH
entry.description: Vehicle is in passthrough mode, being controlled by a pilot.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Vehicle is in waypoint mode, navigating to waypoints.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_MID_LEVEL
entry.description: Vehicle is executing mid-level commands.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_RETURNING
entry.description: Vehicle is returning to the home location.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_LANDING
entry.description: Vehicle is landing.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_LOST
entry.description: Lost connection with vehicle.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_SELECTIVE_PASSTHROUGH
entry.description: Vehicle is in selective passthrough mode, where selected surfaces are being manually controlled.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_ISR
entry.description: Vehicle is in ISR mode, performing reconaissance at a point specified by ISR_LOCATION message.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_LINE_PATROL
entry.description: Vehicle is patrolling along lines between waypoints.

entry.name: SLUGS_MODE_GROUNDED
entry.description: Vehicle is grounded or an error has occurred.

enum.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode the control surfaces for selective passthrough mode. If a bit is set then the pilot console has control of the surface, and if not then the autopilot has control of the surface.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_THROTTLE
entry.description: 0b10000000 Throttle control passes through to pilot console.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_LEFT_AILERON
entry.description: 0b01000000 Left aileron control passes through to pilot console.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_RIGHT_AILERON
entry.description: 0b00100000 Right aileron control passes through to pilot console.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_RUDDER
entry.description: 0b00010000 Rudder control passes through to pilot console.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_LEFT_ELEVATOR
entry.description: 0b00001000 Left elevator control passes through to pilot console.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_RIGHT_ELEVATOR
entry.description: 0b00000100 Right elevator control passes through to pilot console.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_LEFT_FLAP
entry.description: 0b00000010 Left flap control passes through to pilot console.

entry.name: CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG_RIGHT_FLAP
entry.description: 0b00000001 Right flap control passes through to pilot console.

message.name: CPU_LOAD
message.description: Sensor and DSC control loads.

message.name: SENSOR_BIAS
message.description: Accelerometer and gyro biases.

message.name: DIAGNOSTIC
message.description: Configurable diagnostic messages.

message.name: SLUGS_NAVIGATION
message.description: Data used in the navigation algorithm.
message.field: Measured Airspeed prior to the nav filter in m/s
Y component of the body acceleration
Total Distance to Run on this leg of Navigation
Remaining distance to Run on this leg of Navigation

message.name: DATA_LOG
message.description: Configurable data log probes to be used inside Simulink

message.name: GPS_DATE_TIME
message.description: Pilot console PWM messges.
message.field: Clock Status. See table 47 page 211 OEMStar Manual
GPS and GLONASS usage mask (bit 0 GPS_used? bit_4 GLONASS_used?)

message.name: MID_LVL_CMDS
message.description: Mid Level commands sent from the GS to the autopilot. These are only sent when being operated in mid-level commands mode from the ground.

message.name: CTRL_SRFC_PT
message.description: This message sets the control surfaces for selective passthrough mode.
message.field: Bitfield containing the passthrough configuration, see CONTROL_SURFACE_FLAG ENUM.

message.name: SLUGS_CAMERA_ORDER
message.description: Orders generated to the SLUGS camera mount.
message.field: Order the mount to pan: -1 left, 0 No pan motion, +1 right
Order the mount to tilt: -1 down, 0 No tilt motion, +1 up
Orders the camera mount to move home. The other fields are ignored when this field is set. 1: move home, 0 ignored

message.name: CONTROL_SURFACE
message.description: Control for surface; pending and order to origin.
message.field: ID control surface send 0: throttle 1: aileron 2: elevator 3: rudder

message.name: SLUGS_MOBILE_LOCATION
message.description: Transmits the last known position of the mobile GS to the UAV. Very relevant when Track Mobile is enabled

message.name: SLUGS_CONFIGURATION_CAMERA
message.description: Control for camara.
message.field: ID 0: brightness 1: aperture 2: iris 3: ICR 4: backlight

message.name: ISR_LOCATION
message.description: Transmits the position of watch

message.name: VOLT_SENSOR
message.description: Transmits the readings from the voltage and current sensors
message.field: It is the value of reading 2: 0 - Current, 1 - Foreward Sonar, 2 - Back Sonar, 3 - RPM
Voltage in uS of PWM. 0 uS = 0V, 20 uS = 21.5V
Depends on the value of r2Type (0) Current consumption in uS of PWM, 20 uS = 90Amp (1) Distance in cm (2) Distance in cm (3) Absolute value

message.name: PTZ_STATUS
message.description: Transmits the actual Pan, Tilt and Zoom values of the camera unit
message.field: The Pan value in 10ths of degree
The Tilt value in 10ths of degree

message.name: UAV_STATUS
message.description: Transmits the actual status values UAV in flight
message.field: The ID system reporting the action

message.name: STATUS_GPS
message.description: This contains the status of the GPS readings
message.field: Number of times checksum has failed
The quality indicator, 0=fix not available or invalid, 1=GPS fix, 2=C/A differential GPS, 6=Dead reckoning mode, 7=Manual input mode (fixed position), 8=Simulator mode, 9= WAAS a
Indicates if GN, GL or GP messages are being received
A = data valid, V = data invalid
Magnetic variation direction E/W. Easterly variation (E) subtracts from True course and Westerly variation (W) adds to True course
Positioning system mode indicator. A - Autonomous;D-Differential; E-Estimated (dead reckoning) mode;M-Manual input; N-Data not valid

message.name: NOVATEL_DIAG
message.description: Transmits the diagnostics data from the Novatel OEMStar GPS
message.field: The Time Status. See Table 8 page 27 Novatel OEMStar Manual
Status Bitfield. See table 69 page 350 Novatel OEMstar Manual
Age of the position solution in seconds
Times the CRC has failed since boot

message.name: SENSOR_DIAG
message.description: Diagnostic data Sensor MCU

message.name: BOOT
message.description: The boot message indicates that a system is starting. The onboard software version allows to keep track of onboard soft/firmware revisions. This message allows the sensor and control MCUs to communicate version numbers on startup.
